content: little sea creatures designed by lorraine pistorio i hope you enjoy creating your own little sea creature after completing each tentacle place them as continuing now with the top of the octopus… you did the first one on yarn holders a & place the 48 sts from b until all 8 tentacles have been placed on yarn holder a yarn holders a and b onto the needles placing the stitches from yarn holder b onto the round 1 attach working yarn and knit around needles…place 2-8 k the 48 sts from 9 k14 k2tog x 3 k8 k2tog x 3 k14 = 42 yarn holder b after completing round 9 place removable markers onto the needles on stitch #16 and stitch #27 to denote eye placements so the stitches on 10-19 k yarn holder a 20 k2tog k5 x 6 = 36 sts are on the inside 21 k of the circle 22 k1 k2tog x 12 = 24 sts when you join to 23 k knit in the round 24 k2tog x 12 = 12 sts 25 k do not bind off cut yarn leaving long tail and thread beginning the underside of the octopus… yarn tail onto large-eyed blunt needle thread round 1 attach working yarn and knit around needle through loops of the remaining 12 sts but do 2 k2tog around = 24 sts not pull up to gather yet stuff the octopus firmly 3 k2 k2tog x 6 = 18 sts pulling out the cheek area with the needle when 4 k1 k2tog x 6 = 12 sts stuffed it should measure approx 9 around do not bind off cut then pull up on yarn to gather and secure yarn leaving long tail and thread yarn tail use the long tails to close the openings between the onto large-eyed blunt tentacles octopus should sit flat on a surface needle thread secure yarn tails needle through loops of the remaining embroider the eyes and mouth… 12 sts and pull up to create eyes and mouth as you wish to make the gather and secure eyes i used a french knot wrapping the yarn around the needle 6x 2
